item.title: Rachel add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "Reality continues to ruin my life." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "I wish I had more friends, but people are such jerks. If you can just get most people to leave you alone, you're doing good. If you can find even one person you really like, you're lucky. And if that person can also stand you, you're really lucky." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "Sometimes when I'm talking, my words can't keep up with my thoughts. I wonder why we think faster than we speak. Probably so we can think twice." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Tom Stoppard
item.description: "Pirates could happen to anyone." -- Tom Stoppard

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Tom Stoppard
item.description: "We cross our bridges when we come to them and burn them behind us, with nothing to show for our progress except a memory of the smell of smoke, and a presumption that once our eyes watered." -- Tom Stoppard

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Tom Stoppard
item.description: "It's not the voting that's democracy, it's the counting." -- Tom Stoppard

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Tom Stoppard
item.description: "I'm going to be dead before I read the books I'm going to read." -- Tom Stoppard

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The story so far: In the beginning the Universe was created. This has made a lot of people very angry and been widely regarded as a bad move." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Give a man a fire and he's warm for a day, but set fire to him and he's warm for the rest of his life." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Elizabeth Peters
item.description: "No woman really wants a man to carry her off; she only wants him to want to do it." -- Elizabeth Peters

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "For instance, on the planet Earth, man had always assumed that he was more intelligent than dolphins because he had achieved so much&mdash;the wheel, New York, wars and so on&mdash;whilst all the dolphins had ever done was muck about in the water having a good time. But conversely, the dolphins had always believed that they were far more intelligent than man&mdash;for precisely the same reasons." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "There is a theory which states that if ever anyone discovers exactly what the Universe is for and why it is here, it will instantly disappear and be replaced by something even more bizarre and inexplicable. There is another theory which states that this has already happened." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I refuse to answer that question on the grounds that I don't know the answer" -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The major problem&mdash;<i>one</i> of the major problems, for there are several&mdash;one of the many major problems with governing people is that of whom you get to do it; or rather of who manages to get people to let them do it to them. To summarize: it is a well-known fact that those people who must <i>want</i> to rule people are, ipso facto, those least suited to do it. To summarize the summary: anyone who is capable of getting themselves made President should on no account be allowed to do the job." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The fact that we live at the bottom of a deep gravity well, on the surface of a gas covered planet going around a nuclear fireball 90 million miles away and think this to be normal is obviously some indication of how skewed our perspective tends to be." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Gene Fowler
item.description: "Writing is easy. You only need to stare at a blank piece of paper until drops of blood form on your forehead." -- Gene Fowler

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "You live and learn. At any rate, you live." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "Let's think the unthinkable, let's do the undoable. Let us prepare to grapple with the ineffable itself, and see if we may not eff it after all." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "Time is an illusion. Lunchtime doubly so." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "Space is big. You just won't believe how vastly, hugely, mind-bogglingly big it is. I mean, you may think it's a long way down the road to the chemist's, but that's just peanuts to space." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "A common mistake that people make when trying to design something completely foolproof is to underestimate the ingenuity of complete fools." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "Would it save you a lot of time if I just gave up and went mad now?" -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "It is known that there are an infinite number of worlds, simply because there is an infinite amount of space for them to be in. However, not every one of them is inhabited. Therefore, there must be a finite number of inhabited worlds. Any finite number divided by infinity is as near to nothing as makes no odds, so the average population of all the planets in the Universe can be said to be zero. From this it follows that the population of the whole Universe is also zero, and that any people you may meet from time to time are merely the products of a deranged imagination." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description:
"Just believe everything I tell you, and it will all be very, very simple.'
Ah, well, I'm not sure I believe that." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Douglas Adams
Rachel add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "Don't believe anything you read on the net. Except this. Well, including this, I suppose." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "He hoped and prayed that there wasn't an afterlife. Then he realized there was a contradiction involved here and merely hoped that there wasn't an afterlife." -- Douglas Adams
